overview: From 2025-06-03 to 2025-06-04, elizaos/eliza had 12 new PRs (12 merged), 3 new issues, and 12 active contributors.

topIssues.title: Doesn't work this evm plugin -> @elizaos/plugin-evm
topIssues.author: 0xopsdev
topIssues.body:
I want to run evm ai agent with using plugin-evm
Inside characters/degen.character.json file I set evm plugins and modelprovider as openai.
Then set openai key to .env file
I also import plugin-coingecko, but it works with fetch token price or etc.
But If I want to swap tokens or transfer tokens, it doesn't work

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/caece970-2e01-4591-858c-1ea8842bdfd0)

topIssues.title: Any updates about HyperEVM
topIssues.author: donpushme
topIssues.body:
I am building the Blockchain AI project on HyerEVM chain, I wonder Eliza framework supports this chain.
I have a difficulty to get the HYPE without any CEX, If the Eliza supports bridges, can it help me to get the HYPE from ETH on Ethereum mainnet?

topIssues.title: Pump.fun migration feature
topIssues.author: taprwhiz
topIssues.body:
I am solana / AI agent developer
Regarding to this, we can see launch pump.fun launch two months before. I hope you to implement this also in Eliza framework. There are open-source IDL for pump.fun migration to pump.fun amm pool
Thx

topPRs.title: feat: handleServerSync in an efficient way
topPRs.author: odilitime
topPRs.body:
# Risks

Low

# Background

## What does this PR do?

Introduce a new methods for creating a bunch of entities/rooms in a world in an efficient SQL manner

## What kind of change is this?

Improvements (misc. changes to existing features)

## Why are we doing this? Any context or related work?

Because ai16z discord has 23k entities in it

# Documentation changes needed?

My changes do not require a change to the project documentation.

topPRs.title: attempts to fix messaging stuff + ui changes
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

- **New Features**
  - Added support for navigating and managing multiple direct message (DM) channels per agent, including URL-based DM channel selection.
  - Introduced backend integration for DM channel and related group channel management, enabling real-time creation and deletion.
  - Enhanced chat routing to support URLs with both agent and room identifiers.

- **UI Improvements**
  - Redesigned agent, group, and add-agent cards for a more modern, visually engaging interface.
  - Updated the home page with a dashboard layout, improved loading/empty states, and clear agent/group sections.
  - Enhanced group panel with new icons, visual feedback, and a preview section for group creation/editing.

- **Bug Fixes**
  - Improved toast notifications and error handling for DM and group channel actions.

- **Style**
  - Applied extensive formatting and styling refinements across components for consistency and readability.
  - Added new CSS utilities and animations for richer visual effects.

- **Chores**
  - Removed unused imports and cleaned up code for better maintainability.

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

topPRs.title: feat: macos setup guide
topPRs.author: 0xbbjoker
topPRs.body:
## ðŸ“‹ Summary

This PR adds a comprehensive macOS development setup guide to help developers get started with Eliza on macOS systems. The guide addresses common setup issues and provides step-by-step instructions for a smooth development experience.

## ðŸŽ¯ Problem Solved

Based on community feedback and GitHub issues (like #2360), many developers encounter setup challenges when trying to run Eliza on macOS, particularly with:
- Native dependency compilation issues (better-sqlite3, canvas)
- Node.js version compatibility
- Missing system dependencies
- Homebrew package management

## ðŸ“– What's Added

- **Complete macOS Setup Guide**: Step-by-step instructions for setting up the development environment
- **Dependency Management**: Clear guidance on installing required system dependencies via Homebrew
- **Troubleshooting Section**: Solutions for common macOS-specific issues
- **Best Practices**: Recommended tools and configurations for optimal development experience

## ðŸ”§ Files Changed

- **+257 lines**: New comprehensive macOS setup documentation
- **-2 lines**: Minor cleanup/corrections to existing content

## ðŸ§ª Testing

- [ ] Verified setup instructions on clean macOS system
- [ ] Tested dependency installation steps
- [ ] Validated troubleshooting solutions against known issues

## ðŸ“š Documentation Impact

This enhancement improves the developer onboarding experience for macOS users and reduces support overhead by providing self-service solutions to common setup problems.

## ðŸŽ¯ Target Audience

- New developers setting up Eliza development environment on macOS
- Existing developers encountering macOS-specific setup issues
- Contributors looking to develop plugins or features on macOS

---

Resolves setup documentation gaps for macOS development environment
